body_html:
After researching I got to know that it is probably because of my old cmake version(3.5).
So I removed it and updated using the following command:

build=4
mkdir ~/temp
cd ~/temp
wget https://cmake.org/files/v$version/cmake-$version.$build.tar.gz
tar -xzvf cmake-$version.$build.tar.gz
cd cmake-$version.$build/
./bootstrap
make -j4
sudo make install

Then I created new environment and installed caffe2 again and when this time I run cd $DENSEPOSE && make ops I get following error message:

Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree
Reading state information... Done
The following packages were automatically installed and are no longer requ
ired:
cmake-data libjsoncpp1
Use 'sudo apt autoremove' to remove them.
The following packages will be REMOVED:
cmake
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 1 to remove and 12 not upgraded.
After this operation, 14.6 MB disk space will be freed.
Do you want to continue? [Y/n] y
ls.
Use the cmake_policy command to set the policy and suppress this warning
.
get_target_property() called with non-existent target "caffe2".
Call Stack (most recent call first):
/home/g008kaaraan/pytorch/build/Caffe2Config.cmake:106 (caffe2_interface
_library)
CMakeLists.txt:8 (find_package)
This warning is for project developers. Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.
CMake Error at /home/g008kaaraan/pytorch/build/public/utils.cmake:65 (mess
age):
You made a CMake build file error: target caffe2 must be of type either
STATIC_LIBRARY or SHARED_LIBRARY. However, I got
__src_target_type-NOTFOUND.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
/home/g008kaaraan/pytorch/build/Caffe2Config.cmake:106 (caffe2_interface
_library)
CMakeLists.txt:8 (find_package)
-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "/home/g008kaaraan/densepose/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".
See also "/home/g008kaaraan/densepose/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".
Makefile:13: recipe for target 'ops' failed
make: *** [ops] Error 1

Not able to find cause of this. @pjh5 @soumith @jerryzh168 Please help!

body:
After researching I got to know that it is probably because of my old cmake version(3.5).
So I removed it and updated using the following command:
```version=3.11
build=4
mkdir ~/temp
cd ~/temp
wget https://cmake.org/files/v$version/cmake-$version.$build.tar.gz
tar -xzvf cmake-$version.$build.tar.gz
cd cmake-$version.$build/
./bootstrap
make -j4
sudo make install
```
Then I created new environment and installed caffe2 again and when this time I run `cd $DENSEPOSE && make ops` I get following error message:

**Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
The following packages were automatically installed and are no longer requ
ired:
  cmake-data libjsoncpp1
Use 'sudo apt autoremove' to remove them.
The following packages will be REMOVED:
  cmake
0 upgraded, 0 newly installed, 1 to remove and 12 not upgraded.
After this operation, 14.6 MB disk space will be freed.
Do you want to continue? [Y/n] y
ls.
  Use the cmake_policy command to set the policy and suppress this warning
.
  get_target_property() called with non-existent target "caffe2".
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /home/g008kaaraan/pytorch/build/Caffe2Config.cmake:106 (caffe2_interface
_library)
  CMakeLists.txt:8 (find_package)
This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.
CMake Error at /home/g008kaaraan/pytorch/build/public/utils.cmake:65 (mess
age):
  You made a CMake build file error: target caffe2 must be of type either
STATIC_LIBRARY or SHARED_LIBRARY.  However, I got
  __src_target_type-NOTFOUND.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /home/g008kaaraan/pytorch/build/Caffe2Config.cmake:106 (caffe2_interface
_library)
 CMakeLists.txt:8 (find_package)
-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "/home/g008kaaraan/densepose/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".
See also "/home/g008kaaraan/densepose/build/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".
Makefile:13: recipe for target 'ops' failed
make: *** [ops] Error 1**

Not able to find cause of this. @pjh5 @soumith @jerryzh168 Please help!
